2.subquestion: How does one become the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom?

subanswer.text: One becomes the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom by being appointed to the position by the British monarch following an election in which their party wins a majority of the seats in the House of Commons, although in practice, it usually involves the leader of the party or coalition with a majority being chosen as the Prime Minister.

3.subquestion: What determines the composition of the Supreme Court of the United States?

subanswer.text: The composition of the Supreme Court of the United States is determined by Article III, Section 1 of the US Constitution, which sets the number of justices at 'one Justice, and two Judges' when the Constitution was ratified in 1789, and then later set the number at nine in the Judiciary Act of 1869, a number which has remained fixed since the Judiciary Act of 1866. New justices are appointed by the President and confirmed by the Senate.
